required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Repair of the Large Bone Defects Through 3D Printed Individualized Porous Implant
clinical_study.official_title: Repair of the Large Bone Defects Through 3D Printed Individualized Porous Implant: a New "Implant-bone" Interface Fusion Concept for Large Bone Defects Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to investigate the simply use of three-dimensional (3D) printed individualized porous implants in the absence of autogenous/allogeneic bone graft or any osteoinductive agents to treat the large bone defects caused by varies of pathogenesis and systematically study its long-term therapeutic effect and osseointegration characteristics.

detailed_description.textblock: A selection of fifty-eight patients with large bone defects caused by tumor, infection or trauma received the individualized porous implants treatment, and two typical cases were chosen for detailed study. Further, the large segmental femur defect model of sheep was utilized to study the osseointegration characteristics of the individualized porous implants in 1, 3, 6 months after implantation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate after the bone defect reconstruction.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluete the immediate and long-term biomechanical stability of the bone-implant complex after surgery by the following indicator: the loosening, subsidence, displacement of the implants from radiographic examination and The symptoms of the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluete the immediate and long-term biomechanical stability of the bone-implant complex after surgery by the following indicator: the loosening, subsidence, displacement of the implants from radiographic examination and The symptoms of the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluete the immediate and long-term biomechanical stability of the bone-implant complex after surgery by the following indicator: the loosening, subsidence, displacement of the implants from radiographic examination and The symptoms of the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluete the immediate and long-term biomechanical stability of the bone-implant complex after surgery by the following indicator: the loosening, subsidence, displacement of the implants from radiographic examination and The symptoms of the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 14 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluete the immediate and long-term biomechanical stability of the bone-implant complex after surgery by the following indicator: the loosening, subsidence, displacement of the implants from radiographic examination and The symptoms of the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluete the immediate and long-term biomechanical stability of the bone-implant complex after surgery by the following indicator: the loosening, subsidence, displacement of the implants from radiographic examination and The symptoms of the patient.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediate after the bone defect reconstruction.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the osseointegration characteristics of the bone-implant complex by using CT scan to quantify the callus bridging at the outer surface of the implants or the bone growing into the porous implants.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the osseointegration characteristics of the bone-implant complex by using CT scan to quantify the callus bridging at the outer surface of the implants or the bone growing into the porous implants.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the osseointegration characteristics of the bone-implant complex by using CT scan to quantify the callus bridging at the outer surface of the implants or the bone growing into the porous implants.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the osseointegration characteristics of the bone-implant complex by using CT scan to quantify the callus bridging at the outer surface of the implants or the bone growing into the porous implants.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the osseointegration characteristics of the bone-implant complex by using CT scan to quantify the callus bridging at the outer surface of the implants or the bone growing into the porous implants.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 20 months after the bone defect reconstruction.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the osseointegration characteristics of the bone-implant complex by using CT scan to quantify the callus bridging at the outer surface of the implants or the bone growing into the porous implants.

arm_group.description: The patients with large bone defects who treated by 3D printed individualized porous implants

intervention.description: Use 3D printed individualized porous implants to reconstruct the large bone defects caused by tumor, infection or trauma.

study_pop.textblock: The patients with bone tumor or bone infection who are diagnosed with large bone defects after receiving surgery in our Peking University Third Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Large bone defects (ï¼ž4cm) in spine, limb bone and hip joint caused by tumor, infection or other pathogenesis received the individualized porous implants treatment.Exclusion Criteria:
- Bone defects less than 4cm long.
- Bone defects treated by other methods ,such as ilizarov technique, masquelet technique or Ti mesh.
